greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = phi(n^7).
comment: Number of solutions of the equation gcd(x_1^2 + ... + x_7^2, n)=1 with 0 < x_i <= n.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
C. Calderón, J. M. Grau, A. Oller-Marcén, and László Tóth, Counting invertible sums of squares modulo n and a new generalization of Euler totient function, arXiv:1403.7878 [math.NT], 2014.
formula: Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s - 7) / zeta(s - 6). The n-th term of the Dirichlet inverse is n^6 * A023900(n) = (-1)^omega(n) * a(n) / A003557(n), where omega=A001221. - _Álvar Ibeas_, Nov 24 2017
maple: with(numtheory); A239442:=n->phi(n^7); seq(A239442(n), n=1..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 01 2014
xref: Defining Phi_k(n):= number of solutions of the equation gcd(x_1^2 + ... + x_k^2, n) = 1 with 0 < x_i <= n.
results.author: _José María Grau Ribas_, Mar 19 2014
